item.title: Datchelor Place is a pedestrian only space. No LIMES NO FORESTS, 21st December
item.description:
Lime has been moved to end of street to Sheffield bike rack where it meets Camberwell Church Street. Stop Parking on this pedestrian only space

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Datchelor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water main about to burst?, 21st December
item.description:
Water is issuing from the pavement and kerb stones in more than one location near to the college and leisure centre. This has worsened from the usual trickle, and the water now resembles a very small fountain in one place. This presents an ice hazard if cold weather develops, and is unpleasant for pedestrians from car splashing. From previous experience, this is likely to develop into a more serious water main burst needing road closures especially as there are other utilities in the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Brampton Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned white goods in stairwell, 21st December
item.description:
Someone has left this in the stairwell of Lowell House, between the first and second floors (flats 3-4 and 5-6). It was previously abandoned on the walkway before being dumped here, and is an impediment to access (especially in emergencies).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethwin Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox still there., 21st December
item.description:
Hi there, A report of a dead fox was made by my neighbour on Monday (I believe it was). Sadly the fox is still there. We have many children living in the building, that have to see the animal each morning. Please send someone out to deal with the matter. I don't really want to have to dispose of the corpse!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southend Crescent, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet
